uniol.apt.analysis.invariants

Class InvariantCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.invariants.InvariantCalculator

  • public class InvariantCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    A calculator for invariants and testing if a net is covered by invariants. Provides two differient algorithms for calculating the invariants. The first algorithm is descripted in http://de.scribd.com/doc/49919842/Pn-ESTII (slide 88) and the other is also based an the farkas algorithm and is descripted in http://pipe2.sourceforge.net/documents/PIPE-Report.pdf (page 19) which is based on the paper of D'Anna and Trigila "Concurrent system analysis using Petri nets â€“ an optimised algorithm for finding net invariants", Mario D'Anna and Sebastiano Trigila, Computer Communications vol 11, no. 4 august 1988.
    Author:
    Dennis-Michael Borde, Manuel Gieseking

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  InvariantCalculator.Check11bResult
      Holds the result of the check11b-check.
      static class  InvariantCalculator.InvariantAlgorithm
      Enumeration for choosing which algorithm should be used.
      private static class  InvariantCalculator.PpPm
      A class for holding the sets P+ = {j | c_hj > 0} and P- = {j | c_hj less 0} for a given row.

      • calcPpPm

        private static java.util.List<InvariantCalculator.PpPm> calcPpPm(Matrix matC)
        Calculates for a given matrix the P+ = {j | c_hj > 0} and P- = {j | c_hj less 0} sets for each row.
        Parameters:
        matC - - the matrix from which the sets should be calculated.
        Returns:
        The result of the calculation

      • check11

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> check11(java.util.List<InvariantCalculator.PpPm> pppms)
        Checks if some row of the given matrix satisfy P+ == {} xor P- == {} and return this row or null if such a row do not exists.
        Parameters:
        pppms - - the list of all rows with P+ and P- sets.
        Returns:
        the row which satisfy P+ == {} xor P- == {} or null if not existent.

        Checks if there exists a row in the given matrix such that |P+| == 1 or |P-| == 1 and returns the row or null if such a row do not exists.
        Parameters:
        pppms - the list of all rows with P+ and P- sets.
        Returns:
        the row which satisfy |P+| == 1 or |P-| == 1 or null if not existent.

      • coveredBySInvariants

        public static Vector coveredBySInvariants(PetriNet pn)
        Checks whether the the given petri net is covered by s-invariants with the pipe algorithm. Returns the invariant which covers or null if not existent.
        Parameters:
        pn - - the petri net to check covered.
        Returns:
        the invariant which covers or null if it is not covered.

        Parameters:

        algo - - the algorithm with which it should be checked.
        Returns:

      • getMapping

        public static <T extends Node> java.util.Set<java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer>> getMapping(java.util.Set<T> nodes,
                                                                                            java.util.Set<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> invariants)
        Generates for every given invariant a mapping to the given nodes.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - Place or Transition (extends Node) depending on t- or s-invariants are given.
        Parameters:
        nodes - - the nodes for the mapping.
        invariants - - the invariants which should be mapped.
        Returns:
        a set of invariants mapped to the given nodes.
